#summary Web application Integration Test.
#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation

= Introduction =

To test a web application all is needed is a class that extends from AbstractIntegrationHttpTest and a minimal annotation configuration:

@HttpIntegrationConfigurationTest(port=9006, root="/test", src="src/main/resources/webapp/test")

port: embedded web server listener port.

root: web application root context.

src: actual location of the web application.

Can be executed as a standard JUnit test from Eclipse or from Maven or Ant.

= Details =

{{{
@HttpIntegrationConfigurationTest(port=9006, root="/test", src="src/main/resources/webapp/test")
public class EmbeddedIntegrationHttpTest extends AbstractIntegrationHttpTest {
	
	public void test() {
		assertNotNull(super.getWebApplicationContext());
		assertNotNullContextPath();
		assertEqualsContextPath("/test");
	}

	public void testRequest() {
		String uri = "http://localhost:9006/test/index.html";
		assertResponseStatusOK(uri);
		assertContentNotEmpty(uri);
	}
}
}}}

That's all is needed to implement and execute the integration test. No need to have installed web server as a embedded one is used.
